name: HD 41004 A
scenarioDescription:
The HD 41004 A Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 41004 A is a star with NaN times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

HD 41004 A is known to have undefined exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 41004 A system


HD 41004 A b

HD 41004 A b was discovered by the undefined observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is NaN astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 41004 A b is 807.72 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 41004 A b is 13.2 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 41004 A b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 41004 A, which contains undefined planets and was discovered by undefined.
